result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damion Raynard Pegues

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damion Raynard Pegues appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Damion Raynard Pegues.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Krejci requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Case calendared for a Status Conference on 8-29-2022. Court is not in sessesion. Mattter is adjourned.
New date selected via email with defense counsel. Status Conference scheduled August 24, 2022 at 9:30am - via zoom.

Defendant Damion Raynard Pegues in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense counsel submitted a request  for substitution of  Judge Watts- post rotation. 
Court finds the request  timely and consented to substitution against Judge  JD Watts
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davila Branch 1.
Court ordered matter transferred and adjourned to Branch 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damion Raynard Pegues in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci via Zoom.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court they do not yet have discovery from SPD and requests an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Damion Raynard Pegues not in court, in custody.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Victim ( DR) appears in court. 

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will be held  In person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case set for a Status Conference. Defendant in custody. Defense counsel in a different county. Case adjourned to 5-25-2022 at 8:30am.
At the request of the victim, Court ordered the no contact order be modified to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court, defendant Damion Raynard Pegues not in court, in custody.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Atty. Kline is leaving the SPD office and requests this matter be set for a status of counsel date.    Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with D.A.R (DOB 09/25/97)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damion Raynard Pegues in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Damion Raynard Pegues in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damion Raynard Pegues appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
